event_name: Lithuanian Army enters Vilnius (parade in the city center)
event_description: Marks the return of Vilnius to Lithuanian administration after the October 1939 Soviet–Lithuanian treaty.
location_text: Vilnius, Gediminas Avenue / Cathedral Square area

event_name: First mass Soviet deportations from Vilnius
event_description: Start of the 1941 “June deportation,” when residents were sent to Siberia.
tags: Soviet occupation; WWII; World War II

event_name: The creation of the Vilnius Great Ghetto
event_description: The Great Vilnius Ghetto was created on 6 September 1941 and liquidated on 23 September 1943. There were about 29,000 Jews in the Great Ghetto, most of who were killed in Paneriai.
tags: WWII; World War II; Nazi occupation; Holocaust
location_text: Vilnius, the area of the Great Ghetto

event_name: The liquidation of the Vilnius Great Ghetto
event_description: The Great Vilnius Ghetto was created on 6 September 1941 and liquidated on 23 September 1943. There were about 29,000 Jews in the Great Ghetto, most of who were killed in Paneriai.
tags: WWII; World War II; Nazi occupation; Holocaust
location_text: Vilnius, the area of the Great Ghetto

event_description: Largest Nazi mass-murder site in Lithuania; ~70,000 Jews among ~100,000 victims.
tags: WWII; World War II; Nazi occupation; Holocaust

event_name: Vilnius University is closed by the German occupation authorities
event_description: German authorities shut the university and arrested staff and students during a wider clampdown on higher education.
tags: WWII; World War II; Nazi occupation; education

event_name: Soviet 35th Guards Tank Brigade seizes Vilnius airport (then “Porubanek” airfield) during the Battle of Vilnius
tags: WWII; World War II; Battle of Vilnius

event_name: German defense collapses into pockets around the prison and the observatory during the Battle of Vilnius
event_description: A Soviet attack on the morning of 13 July split the German forces into two pockets centred on the prison and the observatory.
tags: WWII; World War II; Battle of Vilnius
location_text: Vilnius, Lukiškių skg. 6; Vilnius, Universiteto g. 3

event_name: Retreating Germans destroy the Green Bridge (Žaliasis tiltas)
event_description: As the Wehrmacht withdrew, the city’s central bridge was blown up; it was rebuilt after the war.
tags: WWII; World War II; Battle of Vilnius

event_description: Vilnius’s first purpose-built cinema, “Iliuzija” (“Illusion”), opened with seating for about 200.
Over 2,000 participants gathered in a major national congress demanding political autonomy for Lithuania within the Russian Empire—pivotal in paving the way toward 1918 independence.
tags: political history; Lithuanian independence; Russian Empire
